TestCase.TestCase_Title: Tests of the transverse Orchestra Explorer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Prepare artefacts for tests
Create directory d:\Tests\Artefacts
Create Excel file excel1.xls in d:\Tests\Artefacts
Create Powerpoint file powerpoint1.ppt in d:\Tests\Artefacts, with 5 slides
Create Word file word1.doc in d:\Tests\Artefacts with 3 bookmarks: Bookmark7, Bookmark8 and Bookmark9
Create directory d:\Tests\Artefacts\1
Create Excel file excel12.xls in d:\Tests\Artefacts\1
Create directory d:\Tests\Artefacts\1\12
Create Powerpoint file powerpoint12.ppt in d:\Tests\Artefacts\1\12, with 5 slides
Create Word file word1.doc in d:\Tests\Artefacts\1\12 with 3 bookmarks: Bookmark1, Bookmark2 and Bookmark3
Create directory d:\Tests\Artefacts\2
Create Powerpoint file powerpoint21.ppt in d:\Tests\Artefacts\2, with 5 slides
Create Word file word21.doc in d:\Tests\Artefacts\2 with 3 bookmarks: Bookmark4, Bookmark5 and Bookmark6
Create directory d:\Tests\Artefacts\2\21
Create Excel file excel21.xls in d:\Tests\Artefacts\2\21
Prepare context
Launch the Orchestra Framework
Create a new administrator context called "Silver"
Within the "Silver" context, click on the "Orchestra" category

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The variable viewer contains a "Segment" variable whose default value is "Gold"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Edit "Segment" variable and set its value to "Silver"
Edit the "\Orchestra\ArtefactPath" variable and new "FileSystem\Directories in File System" environment with value "d:\Tests\Artefacts"
Edit the "\Orchestra\ConfigurationDirectories" variable and add a new "FileSystem\Directories in File System" environment whose values are paths to ConfdirOffice and ConfdirOrchestraFramework
Save context
Set "Silver" context as current context

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE does not display any artefact.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Artefact selection
In Firefox web navigator, browse the following URL: orchestra:Explorer://FrameworkCommands/FC?title=My%20Explorer

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog pops up. Its title is "My Explorer". It displays 3 artefact types: Excel,Powerpoint and Word. The "OK" button is disabled

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on th "+" button to expand artefacts

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The following artefacts are displayed : excel1, 1/excel12, 2/21/excel21, 1/12/powerpoint12, powerpoint1, 2/powerpoint21, word1, 1/12/word12, 2/word21

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Select the following artefacts: excel1, 1/12/powerpoint12, 2/word21

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "OK" button has been enabled.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "OK" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog disappears

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the Orchestra Framework, find path to the "Explorer_status.status" file in the Console view and edit it in a text editor
In the Explorer_status.status file, find the path to the GEF file "Explorer_FrameworkCommands.gef" from the "exportFilePath" attribute and edit it in a text editor

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The GEF file provides 3 elements matching the selected artefacts and their URI: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <gef:GEF xmlns:gef="http://www.thalesgroup.com/orchestra/framework/4_0_24/Gef"> <GENERIC_EXPORT_FORMAT> <ELEMENT label="excel1" type="Excel" uri="orchestra://Excel/excel1"> <PROPERTIES> <PROPERTY name="Environment" type="string">FS : [D:\Tests\Artefacts]</PROPERTY> <PROPERTY name="AbsolutePath" type="string">D:\Tests\Artefacts\excel1.xls</PROPERTY> <PROPERTY name="RelativePath" type="string">excel1.xls</PROPERTY> <PROPERTY name="EnvironmentId" type="string">87619cee-7971-452e-9ae7-57ac545305a8</PROPERTY> </PROPERTIES> </ELEMENT> <ELEMENT label="1/12/powerpoint12" type="Powerpoint" uri="orchestra://Powerpoint/1%2F12%2Fpowerpoint12"> <PROPERTIES> <PROPERTY name="Environment" type="string">FS : [D:\Tests\Artefacts]</PROPERTY> <PROPERTY name="AbsolutePath" type="string">D:\Tests\Artefacts\1\12\powerpoint12.ppt</PROPERTY> <PROPERTY name="RelativePath" type="string">1\12\powerpoint12.ppt</PROPERTY> <PROPERTY name="EnvironmentId" type="string">87619cee-7971-452e-9ae7-57ac545305a8</PROPERTY> </PROPERTIES> </ELEMENT> <ELEMENT label="2/word21" type="Word" uri="orchestra://Word/2%2Fword21"> <PROPERTIES> <PROPERTY name="Environment" type="string">FS : [D:\Tests\Artefacts]</PROPERTY> <PROPERTY name="AbsolutePath" type="string">D:\Tests\Artefacts\2\word21.doc</PROPERTY> <PROPERTY name="RelativePath" type="string">2\word21.doc</PROPERTY> <PROPERTY name="EnvironmentId" type="string">87619cee-7971-452e-9ae7-57ac545305a8</PROPERTY> </PROPERTIES> </ELEMENT> </GENERIC_EXPORT_FORMAT> </gef:GEF>

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Artefact sets selection
In Firefox web navigator, browse the following URL: orchestra:Explorer://FrameworkCommands/FC?title=My%20Explorer

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog pops up. Its title is "My Explorer". It displays 3 artefact types: Excel,Powerpoint and Word. The "OK" button is disabled

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Switch to "Folded" mode
Click on th "+" button to expand artefacts sets

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Within "Excel" root type, there are 3 artefact sets : 1, 2, 2/21 Within "Powerpoint" root type, there are 3 aretfact sets: 1, 1/12, 2 Within "Word" root type, there are 3 artefact sets: 1, 1/12, 2

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Within "Excel" root type, select "2/21" artefact set and within "Word" root type, select "1" artefact set

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "OK" button has been enabled.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "OK" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog disappears

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the Orchestra Framework, find path to the "Explorer_status.status" file in the Console view and edit it in a text editor
In the Explorer_status.status file, find the path to the GEF file "Explorer_FrameworkCommands.gef" from the "exportFilePath" attribute and edit it in a text editor

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The GEF file provides 2 elements matching the selected artefact sets and their URI: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <gef:GEF xmlns:gef="http://www.thalesgroup.com/orchestra/framework/4_0_24/Gef"> <GENERIC_EXPORT_FORMAT> <ELEMENT fullName="" label="2.21" type="" uri="orchestra://ArtefactSet/ASU?LogicalFolderPath=2%2F21"/> <ELEMENT fullName="" label="1" type="" uri="orchestra://ArtefactSet/ASU?LogicalFolderPath=1"/> </GENERIC_EXPORT_FORMAT> </gef:GEF>

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Root type filtering
In Firefox web navigator, browse the following URL: orchestra:Explorer://FrameworkCommands/FC?title=My%20Explorer&filterRootType=Word%3BExcel

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog pops up. Its title is "My Explorer". It displays 2 artefact types: Excel and Word. The "OK" button is disabled.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on "Cancel" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog disappears

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the Orchestra Framework, find path to the "Explorer_status.status" file in the Console view and edit it in a text editor

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A status code with a "WARNING" severity has been returned.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Artefact pre-selection

In Firefox web navigator, browse the following URL: orchestra:Explorer://FrameworkCommands/FC?title=My%20Explorer&selectedURIs=orchestra%3A%2F%2FExcel%2F1%252Fexcel12%3Borchestra%3A%2F%2FWord%2F1%252F12%252Fword12%2FBookmark%2FBookmark2%3Borchestra%3A%2F%2FWord%2F2%252Fword21%2FBookmark%2FBookmark6%3Borchestra%3A%2F%2FPowerpoint%2Fpowerpoint1

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog pops up. Its title is "My Explorer". Within"Excel" root type , 1/excel12 artefact has been selected Within "Powerpoint" root type , powerpoint1 has been selected Within "Word" root type, both 1/12/word12 and 2/word21 artefacts have been decorated with a "warning" icon

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right-click on artefact 1/12/word12 and select "Get/Refresh sub-artefacts list" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Sub-artefacts are displayed below the 1/12/word12 artefact and the "Bookmark2" sub-artefact has been selected. Both 1/excel12 and powerpoint1 are still selected

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right-click on artefact 2/word21 and select "Get/Refresh sub-artefacts list" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Sub-artefacts are displayed below the 2/word21 artefact and the "Bookmark6" sub-artefact has been selected. 1/excel12 and powerpoint1 as well as "Bookmark2" are still selected

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on "Cancel" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog disappears

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Artefact sets pre-selection

In Firefox web navigator, browse the following URL: orchestra:Explorer://FrameworkCommands/FC?title=My%20Explorer&selectedURIs=orchestra%3A%2F%2FArtefactSet%2FASU%3FLogicalFolderPath%3D1%3Borchestra%3A%2F%2FArtefactSet%2FASU%3FLogicalFolderPath%3D2%252F21

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog pops up. It has switched to "Folded" mode. Its title is "My Explorer". Within "Excel" root type, both "1" and "2/12" artefact sets have been selected. Within "Powerpoint" root type, "1" artefact set has been selected. Within "Word" root type, "1" artefact set has been selected. The "OK" button has been enabled.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on "Cancel" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog disappears

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Selectable root types
Restart the Orchestra Framework
In Firefox web navigator, browse the following URL: orchestra:Explorer://FrameworkCommands/FC?title=My%20Explorer&selectableType=PowerPoint%3BWord

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog pops up. Its title is "My Explorer". It displays 3 artefact types: Excel,Powerpoint and Word. The "OK" button is disabled

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on th "+" button to expand artefacts

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The following artefacts are displayed : excel1, 1/excel12, 2/21/excel21, 1/12/powerpoint12, powerpoint1, 2/powerpoint21, word1, 1/12/word12, 2/word21

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Select the following artefacts: 1/excel12, 2/powerpoint21, word1

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "OK" button is disabled

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Unselect artefact "1/excel12"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The '"OK" button has been enabled.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on "Cancel" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog disappears

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Mono selection
In Firefox web navigator, browse the following URL: orchestra:Explorer://FrameworkCommands/FC?title=My%20Explorer&multiSelect=no

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog pops up. Its title is "My Explorer". It displays 3 artefact types: Excel,Powerpoint and Word. The "OK" button is disabled

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on th "+" button to expand artefacts

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The following artefacts are displayed : excel1, 1/excel12, 2/21/excel21, 1/12/powerpoint12, powerpoint1, 2/powerpoint21, word1, 1/12/word12, 2/word21

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Select "excel1" artefact
Select artefact "powerpoint1" thought Control + mouse click

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "excel1" artefact has been unselected and "powerpoint1" has been selected

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on "Cancel" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog disappears

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Multi selection
In Firefox web navigator, browse the following URL: orchestra:Explorer://FrameworkCommands/FC?title=My%20Explorer&multiSelect=yes

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog pops up. Its title is "My Explorer". It displays 3 root types: Excel,Powerpoint and Word. The "OK" button is disabled

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on th "+" button to expand artefacts

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The following artefacts are displayed : excel1, 1/excel12, 2/21/excel21, 1/12/powerpoint12, powerpoint1, 2/powerpoint21, word1, 1/12/word12, 2/word21

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Select "excel1" artefact
Select artefact "powerpoint1" thought Control + mouse click

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "excel1" artefact is still selected and "powerpoint1" has been selected

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on "Cancel" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog disappears

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Display an optional message
In Firefox web navigator, browse the following URL: orchestra:Explorer://FrameworkCommands/FC?title=My%20Explorer&message=Artefacts%20Microsoft%20Office

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog pops up. Its title is "My Explorer". A "Artefacts Microsoft Office" is displayed right below the title bar.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on "Cancel" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog disappears

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Title is mandatory
In Firefox web navigator, browse the following URL: orchestra:Explorer://FrameworkCommands/FC

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog does not show up

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the Orchestra Framework, find path to the "Explorer_status.status" file in the Console view and edit it in a text editor

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An error message: "'title' parameter is mandatory." has been returned for URI "orchestra://FrameworkCommands/FC"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Sorting artefacts
Create a Powerpoint file "powerpoint3.ppt" in d:\Temp
Edit \Orchestra\ArtefactPath variable and add a new "FileSystem\Directories in File System" environment with value "d:\Temp"
Save "Silver" context
Set "Silver" context as current context

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the OE, aretefacts are not updated and the "powerpoint3" artefact is not visible.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In Firefox web navigator, browse the following URL: orchestra:Explorer://FrameworkCommands/FC?title=My%20Explorer

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The OE dialog pops up. Its title is "My Explorer". It displays 3 artefact types: Excel,Powerpoint and Word. The "OK" button is disabled

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the bottom arrow and select "Group by..." -> "Flat"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The following artefacts are displayed (by default, sorted by environment): (environment FS D:\Tests\Artefacts) 1/12/powerpoint12, powerpoint1, word1, excel1, 2/powerpoint21, 1/12/word12, 1/excel12, 2/21/excel21, 2/word21, (environment FS d:\Temp) powerpoint3 In the Orchestra Framework, artefacts are still grouped by "Type"

Step_Freecolumn1.Step_Freecolumn1_label: In the Orchestra Framework, artefacts are grouped by type, by default

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the bottom arrow and select "Sort..." -> "Name"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The artefacts are displayed in the following order : 1/12/powerpoint12, 1/12/word12, 1/excel12, 2/21/excel21, 2/powerpoint21, 2/word21, excel1, powerpoint1, powerpoint3, word1 In the Orchestra Framework, artefacts are still sorted by "Environment"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the bottom arrow and select "Sort..." -> "Type"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: 'The artefacts are displayed in the following order : 1/excel12, 2/21/excel21, excel1, 1/12/powerpoint12, 2/powerpoint21, powerpoint1, powerpoint3, 1/12/word12, 2/word21, word1

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Grouping artefacts
Click on the bottom arrow and select "Group by..." -> "Environment"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Two environments are displayed: "FS : [D:\temp]" and "FS : [D:\Tests\Artefacts]"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on th "+" button to expand artefacts

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Within "FS : [D:\temp]" environment, there is 1 artefact : powerpoint3 Within "FS : [D:\Tests\Artefacts]" environment, there are the following artefacts (sorted by type): 1/excel12, 2/21/excel21, excel1, 1/12/powerpoint12, 2/powerpoint21, powerpoint1, powerpoint3, 1/12/word12, 2/word21, word1

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the bottom arrow and select "Group by..." -> "Type"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: 3 root types are displayed: Excel,Powerpoint and Word.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on th "+" button to expand artefacts

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Excel" root type contains the following artefacts are displayed: 1/excel12, 2/21/excel21, excel1 The "Powerpoint" root type contains the following artefacts: 1/12/powerpoint12, 2/powerpoint21, powerpoint1, powerpoint3 The "Word" root type contains the following artefacts: 1/12/word12, 2/word21, word1

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Getting the segment name with the Java API.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Look into the IDD

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A "getSegmentName" method from the VariableManagerAdapter is documented in the IDD
